00022 #include "copynumber/WaveletShrink.h"
00023 
00024 #include <cmath>
00025 #include <cstdio>

00027 
00028 using std::valarray;
00029 using std::vector;
00030 
00031 static void wavelet_sandbox_iter(valarray<double> & data_vec, Wavelet * W,
00032                 vector<double>likelihood_prec, double prior_prec, MODE mode,
00033                 double converge);
00034 
00035 static void shrink_mrf1(valarray<double> & vec, double likelihood_prec,
00036                 double prior_prec, double converge);
00037 
00038 
00039 void wavelet_sandbox(valarray<double> & data_vec, Wavelet * W,
00040                 vector<double>likelihood_prec, double prior_prec, MODE mode,
00041                 double converge, bool outlier, double nu, int maxiter)
00042     {
00043         if (!outlier) {
00044                 wavelet_sandbox_iter(data_vec, W, likelihood_prec, prior_prec,
00045                         mode, converge);
00046                 return;
00047                 }
00048 
00049         int N = data_vec.size();
00050         valarray<double> data(data_vec);
00051         valarray<double> resids(N);
00052 
00053         double S = 1.0;
00054         valarray<double> prec_vec(1.0,N);
00055 
00056         int count=0;
00057         while (count < maxiter) {
00058                 wavelet_sandbox_iter(data, W, likelihood_prec, prior_prec,
00059                         mode, converge);
00060 
00061                 resids = data_vec - data;
00062 
00063                 S *= (resids*resids*prec_vec).sum()/N;
00064 
00065                 prec_vec = (nu + 1.0)/(nu*S + resids*resids);
00066 
00067                 data += resids*(prec_vec/prec_vec.sum());
00068 
00069                 count++;
00070                 }
00071 
00072         data_vec = data;
00073     }
00074 
00075 
00076 void wavelet_sandbox_iter(valarray<double> & data_vec, Wavelet * W,
00077                 vector<double>likelihood_prec, double prior_prec, MODE mode,
00078                 double converge)
00079     {
00080         // nothing to do when levels of resolution are exhausted
00081         if (likelihood_prec.empty()) {
00082          return;
00083          }
00084 
00085         // length of the data vector
00086     index_t data_len = (index_t)data_vec.size();
00087 
00088         // length of vector needed to hold the deconstruction / wavelet
00089         // expansion of the data vector
00090     index_t dec_len = dwt_buffer_length(data_len,W->dec_len,mode);
00091 
00092         // for holding the expansions
00093     valarray<double> approximation(0.0, dec_len);
00094     valarray<double> detail(0.0, dec_len);
00095 
00096         // compute the expansions
00097     double_dec_a(&data_vec[0], data_len, W, &approximation[0], dec_len, mode);
00098     double_dec_d(&data_vec[0], data_len, W, &detail[0], dec_len, mode);
00099 
00100         // shrink the details of the expansion
00101         shrink_mrf1(detail, likelihood_prec[0], prior_prec, converge);
00102 
00103         // send the recursive call a front popped version of the 
00104         // likelihood weights.  Note that an empty vector will immediately
00105         // return.
00106         vector<double> lp_next(likelihood_prec.begin() + 1, likelihood_prec.end());
00107 
00108         // send the next level of approximations to have their details shrunk
00109         wavelet_sandbox_iter(approximation, W, lp_next, prior_prec, mode, converge);
00110 
00111         // the length of the vector and vector to reconstruct the approximation
00112     index_t rec_len = reconstruction_buffer_length(dec_len,W->rec_len);
00113     valarray<double> rec_vec(0.0, rec_len);
00114 
00115         // add the approximation to the reconstruction
00116     double_upsampling_convolution_valid_sf(&approximation[0],dec_len,
00117             W->rec_lo_double, W->rec_len,
00118             &rec_vec[0], rec_len, mode);
00119 
00120         // add the shrunk details to the reconstruction
00121     double_upsampling_convolution_valid_sf(&detail[0],dec_len,
00122             W->rec_hi_double, W->rec_len,
00123             &rec_vec[0], rec_len, mode);
00124 
00125         // write over the input approximation based on shrunk details
00126         // the copy must be made because rec_vec could be longer than
00127         // the original data vec due to padding
00128     for (int i=0; i<data_len; i++) data_vec[i] = rec_vec[i];
00129     }
00130 
00131 
00132 
00133 // need to comment how shrinkage works
00134 void shrink_mrf1(valarray<double> & vec,
00135                 double likelihood_prec, double prior_prec,
00136                 double converge) {
00137 
00138         int N = vec.size();
00139         double tau=likelihood_prec;
00140         double beta=prior_prec;
00141 
00142         double x;
00143 
00144         double prec1 = 1.0/(tau + fabs(beta));
00145         double prec2 = 1.0/(tau + 2.0*fabs(beta));
00146 
00147         valarray<double>vec1(vec.size());
00148         valarray<double>old_vec(vec.size());
00149 
00150         vec1 = vec;
00151 
00152         while (1) {
00153                 old_vec = vec1;
00154                 x = beta*vec1[1] + tau*vec[0];
00155                 vec1[0] = x*prec1;
00156 
00157 
00158                 for (int i=1; i<N-1; i++) {
00159                         x = beta*(vec1[i-1] + vec1[i+1]) + tau*vec[i];
00160                         vec1[i] = x*prec2;
00161                         }
00162 
00163                 x = beta*vec1[N-2] + tau*vec[N-1];
00164                 vec1[N-1] = x*prec1;
00165 
00166                 double diff_max = abs(vec1 - old_vec).max();
00167                 
00168                 if (diff_max < converge) break;
00169                 }
00170         vec = vec1;
00171         }
